intro: Murdannia sahyadrica, commonly known as the Western Ghats murdannia, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the monsoon season. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in forested areas. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native region.
